node.text:
We see this question all the time—are third party plugins REALLY worth it? ⁣
⁣
Some third party plugins are great, they can make things more convenient, faster, and easier. But are the NECESSARY to make good music? ⁣
⁣
Let us know what you think!⁣
⁣
Follow us for more on these topics @cosmicacademy:⁣⁣⁣
⁣
𝐅𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐨𝐰 👉 @cosmicacademy 👈⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
𝐅𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐨𝐰 👉 @cosmicacademy 👈⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣

node.text:
Have you explored DYNAMIC EQ yet?⁣
⁣
This feature can be incredibly useful in certain situations, especially on really dynamic material like vocals. ⁣
⁣
Let us know if you have any great uses for dynamic EQ!⁣
⁣
Follow us for more on these topics @cosmicacademy:⁣⁣⁣

node.text:
This might be a bit controversial, but is BALANCE as an artist overrated?⁣
⁣
We’re not saying you should ignore your mental health, and never rest. Rest is important. But in order to really reach your goals, you do have to make some sacrifices!⁣
⁣
What do you think??⁣
⁣
Follow us for more on these topics @cosmicacademy:⁣⁣⁣
⁣
𝐅𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐨𝐰 👉 @cosmicacademy 👈⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣

node.text:
This one goes in the Reverb Tip “HALL OF FAME”
⁣
⁣⁣
Watch the video to fully see how to go about “syncing” your pre-delay to the BPM of your track! ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Pre-delay is the amount of time it takes until the initial onset of reverb.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣
What do we use it for?⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Mainly to create separation between our original sound, and the reverb itself. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
If that reverb begins immediately, it can wash away some of the punch/transients/clarity of our sound. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Because pre-delay introduces a timing difference, it can quickly muddy things up if it’s not rhythmically delaying with the rest of your mix. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
It can create an odd hiccup where things sound out of time. Similar to when you first begin DJ’ing and can’t beat match 😭⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Some reverbs have this “tempo sync” feature already built in. Theres also a formula to do this “delay calculator” trick. Honestly, it’s much quicker to just bookmark this page!⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Type your BPM, and try out different values. See which seems to “gel” the reverb to your mix best!⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Works great on vocals, leads, drums, and more. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Did you learn something new today? Comment and let us know! ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣
🤓 Follow @cosmicacademy 🤓⁣⁣

node.text:
We see a lot of questions about managers. When do you need one? Should you try to find one now?⁣
⁣
A lot of producers think a manager is going to help make them successful. But remember, the only person that can make you successful is YOU 💪⁣
⁣
Follow us for more on these topics @cosmicacademy:⁣⁣⁣

You joined an artist community, now you're in a crew of like-minded artists who have your back. Nah, this didn't happen. Because you didn't take the first step. But, you can make this ALL true for next year... start today. (Follow @CosmicAcademy for more)'.

node.text:
LIKE if you’re going to take the first step 💪⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
All of these things are achievable...⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
Maybe you want to learn piano, or have a podcast, or make a new alias.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
Stop thinking about it, and start doing…⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
You’ll be SHOCKED at how far you’ll go in just 1-year. (I’ll give you 3 great examples)⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
1. When I threw shows, the first couple were TERRIBLE.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
(Totally empty, sh*tty venues, no people, just depressing haha).⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
But after doing it every week for a year… I started getting the hang of it, and it wasn’t so bad.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
2) For awhile we weren’t paying much attention to IG.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
Then Zack and I committed to posting everyday. ⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
Nothing changed overnight.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
But in the first 12 months, we’ve gained over 100k more followers (thank you!!!)⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
3) We also see this with the people who join our Program.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
At first maybe they’re isolated, trying to make it on their own, with no community. ⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
A year later they’re ingrained in our 450 artist family, tons of friends from all over the world. (and some nice results too!)⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
The point is, you gotta start somewhere, so why not now?!⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
Save this post and look back on it in year. Go out there and impress yourself!⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
Follow us @cosmicacademy for more!⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
𝐅𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐨𝐰 👉 @cosmicacademy 👈⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
𝐅𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐨𝐰 👉 @cosmicacademy 👈⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣

node.text:
We see this question all the time—are third party plugins REALLY worth it? ⁣
⁣
Some third party plugins are great, they can make things more convenient, faster, and easier. But are the NECESSARY to make good music? ⁣
⁣
Let us know what you think!⁣
⁣
Follow us for more on these topics @cosmicacademy:⁣⁣⁣

node.text:
A personal fav of mine 💎 read below for more!
⁣
⁣
Use this easy technique, of adding a "5th", to make your bassline stand out even more in the mix.⁣
⁣
⁣
**This works in ANY SYNTH, not just Serum!⁣
⁣
⁣
There are two ways to approach this...⁣
⁣
⁣
SUBTLE: Add a little bit and receive the subtle harmonic benefits to fill out your bassline and help it cut through the mix.⁣
⁣
⁣
OBVIOUS: Add more volume to the "5th" oscillator / layer and you will hear the obvious harmonic difference. Sometimes this works very well as a bassline in your track, but it creates a whole different "feel". It's always worth trying and checking out to see if it fits the current mix. If not? Just go back to being more subtle about it.⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
If you like our video tips, give us a follow:⁣
⁣

node.text:
Its up to 👉 YOU👈 to make KICK and BASS work!!⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
In electronic music, your low end needs to be clean. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
Many times we're taught to just choose any old Kick and Bass and slap an EQ + Sidechain on it. But does that always work? Not really! There's more to it...⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
You should be building your kick and bass to work TOGETHER! ⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
LONGER KICK means you're going to need a SHORTER or HIGHER (octave) BASS.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
SHORTER KICK allows you to have LONGER / BUSIER BASSLINE (Can also be lower octave because it has the space).⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
For example: if you're making a groovy house / tech house track where the bass line needs to carry weight and keep people moving, you're better off going with a shorter kick that gives you the actual TIME AND SPACE to fit that bass line in. A longer kick would mean you'd be overlapping the tail of the kick and the bass...NOT GOOD! ⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
**Beware: Sidechain can't even fix that all the time. You don't want two things playing the same space at the same time when we're talking low end.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
On the flipside, a big room or main room club track may choose to go with the longer kick which eats up that 50hz for almost an entire beat. Now you don't have room for a deep bass line, bump it up to the higher octave! ⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
You can also learn how the "pro's" build theirs by referencing! Use spectrum analyzers (we prefer Voxengo SPAN) to reference the kick and bass of other professional songs. See the levels that they're elements sit at (db) and the frequencies to get a good idea of how they make them fit in their finished, mastered track. Yours should be there too when limited. ⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣

⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
Vocal Riding is a technique used to control dynamics in a vocal performance. Before we get into the two common ways we can use it, you might be asking a pretty common question...⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
Isn't this the job of a compressor!?⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
It sure is.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
But what if you were able to get a more natural sound from that compression, by first "preparing" the vocal...⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
Singers are human. They aren't perfect. Recordings can be TOO dynamic and although they may sound great on their own, it might be a nightmare to mix with the instruments behind it. ⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
Over-working a compressor never sounds great either. Think about it...one word the compressor is squashing, the next its not, and so forth. This is going to produce a different sound and feel to the vocal as each word passes through the compressor. It may not sound cohesive, or balanced.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
We can use VOCAL RIDING to automate the level of the vocal BEFORE we even hit the compressor. Now the compression will be much more balanced and even from word to word, phrase to phrase...giving us a better result!⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
We recommend you do this technique by EAR and not EYE. Listen to the take and determine if certain words are too loud, or too soft, and compensate by automating the level.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣The second way you can use this technique, is towards the end of the chain. Now you can actually automate certain parts of the entire vocal arrangement to be louder than others. For example: if you wanted to emphasize the chorus, you could automate the entire section up a db or two. This is taking an already processed, and balanced vocal, and now having certain sections stand out from others. Completely different than the first way we looked at!⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣

⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
**Bonus: check out Waves Vocal Rider plugin. Does this process for you...really great plugin!⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
𝐅𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐨𝐰 👉 @cosmicacademy 👈⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣

node.text:
ABLETON users 👉 SAVE THIS POST
⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Warping allows us to adjust the timing and pitch of audio clips inside our DAW. ⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Ableton has several different "warp modes" and each have their own strengths / weaknesses. ⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣
The different warp modes do sound different from one another. You want to use your ears and go with what sounds best...however this guide can hopefully get you to that answer as quick as possible!⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣If you like our content, give us a follow:⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
